website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty clipper provides professional performance and is suitable for thicker coats.
pros: High-performance clippers that glide through any length and thickness
Two speeds: low for precision grooming and high for larger areas
Excellent quality from a trusted brand
cons: Design is heavy and awkward to hold
Guide combs and extras must be bought separately, adding to the cost of an already-expensive product

customer_reviews.title: Worse shaver I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: LESS THAN 0 starts.... I have been grooming my Pups for over 15 years. this shaver worked 1 time and after that began to shake horrible. I cannot get the blade to sit right and so my Pups are AFRAID of the shaver. I would like to return it and would appreciate some assistance either getting a new one or returning this one. At this time I would not recommend this shaver. don't trust it, buy from a store that you can return if you have issues.
customer_reviews.author: MBUG

customer_reviews.title: I read reviews that they were sturdy and a lot of people used them on dogs ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these quite a while and forgot to post a review but they were awful for my dogs. I read reviews that they were sturdy and a lot of people used them on dogs with thick undercoats. I have Pyrenees and I couldn't cut their hair for five minutes without this getting hot. It barely worked after two or three uses. Sorry that I wasted my money. If anyone knows of clippers that are strong and sturdy enough for a Pyr please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Movie Lover in AL

customer_reviews.title: finally...
customer_reviews.text: I have a cranky rescue persian with candy floss coat. The knots are incredible and she's a biter so I first tried groomers. The groomers asked me not to bring her back so I then tried other clippers. They tended to skim over her coat instead of cutting. Someone recommended this one and I'm over the moon. Went through knots without heating up too much and no stress for her, which means no bloodshed for me! One knot was a little bigger so I switched to the faster speed. No problem. And not too loud.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: This clipper is horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: This clipper is horrible!!! The screws in the inside that connect / attach the clipper blade loosen and won’t cut my dogs coat. Maybe its the clippers I got but its if they forgot to put lock tight when manufacturing. This may not be what is used to insure screws don’t loosen in the process of trimming your pet but all I know THESE ARE NOT WORTH 1$. I would like a replacement or some one to fix my clippers!!! I tried again to trim my dog and could only get 1/2 way done... poor guy... I know Oster is one of the leading companies for tools like this but this maybe the big deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: tdl74

customer_reviews.title: Best clippers I have ever owned in my life.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely high quality clippers. Had these for two years now. The motor is not brushless and it requires oil frequently so if you're looking for low maintenance clippers, these are not those but you won't find clippers of this quality that do not require maintenance. Brushed motors are more powerful. Also, keeps in mind that these clippers are HEAVY but they cut fast so the problem kind of works itself out. You want lighter clippers so you can use em longer but lighter clippers take longer to cut. If you buy these clippers the fur will just fly of in seconds. You won't HAVE to hold it for long. ^___^
customer_reviews.author: Talada

customer_reviews.title: Great Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a cheaper pair of clippers for years and finally decided to give an upgrade a try. These did not disappoint. I used them to trim up my Aussie and had not issues with them easily going through her fur with the 10 blade. I did purchase a set of guards separately and the clippers worked fine with them on as well. Also used for a quick hair cut on myself and it was quick and easy. I would highly recommend, especially if trimming animals, as these took about a 1/5 th the time of my older, less expensive pair.
customer_reviews.author: Agfisher

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot and breaks easily! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I pulled up my order to try and return this because it is broken and of course, I am just over my 1 year warranty mark. First it gets super hot really quick and you have to constantly stop and let it cool off or it burns the skin. There is a stripped screw that is not fixable so the head will not stay on. I can no longer use it and this was a total waste of $100!!
customer_reviews.author: aratliff33

customer_reviews.title: Good clippers for heavy grooming.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased so many cheap clippers from Amazon for my German Sheppard that I've lost track. I finally broke down and purchased these with the quick take down blade and I can't believe I wasted so much time and money on cheap junk. If your serious about grooming your dog this is definitely a good direction to go. I do concede that they are a little noisy and vibrate a little at times but I found them very powerful and consistent. We have a 70lb German Sheppard and she is a hairy beast. This combination got her hair off in 20mins compared to hours with previous clippers.
customer_reviews.author: jfishermango

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance on Poodles
customer_reviews.text: It's been 1 year and after a very frustrating morning trying to clip a 12 week old standard poodle puppy I finally decided to write a review. The blades are basically disposable you can get 1 maybe 2 clips per blade before they require cleaning every 2-3". The weird part is that they cut the couple inches like butter. I have had blades sharpened and it makes no difference. The only thing that gets a full clip without the ridiculous amount of cleaning time in between clipping is a new blade @ $25+ a pop... Have watched countless videos on cleaning and adjusting but nothing seems to work long term 😭
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Too Hot Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Gets too hot fast! However, I purchased several different size blades since I groom 2 poodles. One, our female, has really fine hair and the boy’s hair is medium-fine. On him I can cut more hair faster than on the female. Her hair is cottony-soft! It plugs the blades from the start. Ten minutes is the maximum before the clippers become too hot to hold in my bare hand. I won’t use gloves because if I can feel the heat so can my dog. I still use these clippers but switch to another brand to allow these to cool. In my experience over the past 20 years clipping bischons and poodles there are cooler clippers out there than this model.
customer_reviews.author: WXYZ

customer_reviews.title: Good for the first cut, not so much after that.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 pound giant schnauzer. I bought these clippers because of some good reviews online and the Oster brand name. The first cut was great, super quick and smooth, but the second was a lot slower. I cleaned and oiled the blades and used tons of the Kool Lube spray that was recommended, but the third cut was almost painful even though my dog's hair was already short. The blades needed several passes to cut at all and at times were just pulling my poor dog's hair. I will be checking to see if I can still return these to the manufacturer, and if not I will pass them on and go for the Andis clippers instead.
customer_reviews.author: Root

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle
customer_reviews.text: Used only 4 times. It DOES cut through my Springer Spaniels' hair like butter, WHEN IT IS WORKING. It is so loud and gets so hot that I cannot hold it. I purchased the recommended cooling spray, but it did not cool the body down enough for me to be able to hold it. After 10 minutes of using it, the motor would begin to stutter and finally stop until I had to turn it off and wait 30 minutes. Very disappointed and wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Manwaring

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Clippers
customer_reviews.text: These are great clippers. I’m a newbie and I wish I had bought the guards. I have a large breed poodle and he was very very overgrown. I will lost a picture so you can see how much hair we had to shave. Because of the density the clippers did get hot and we had to take several breaks. I don’t think this could have been avoided at all. I would buy these again and it has already saved me $100 and paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought these is Feb, they work grea. I have 4 dogs all ranging in hair textures and lengths and the 10 blafe works perfectly. I would have given these 5 stars but they tend to get very hot quickly, especially when using the high speed. I use cooling spray when i take breaks and that help. They are a little noisy, but my dogs got used to it quickly.Otherwise these are great, they have already paid for themselves. They cut through mats and tangles, are easy to manuever. I can use them on my littlest dog (4lbs) just as easy as my big boy(120lbs). The work on paws and faces perfectly, never have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Donna N Leis

customer_reviews.title: I believe this is a fair review
customer_reviews.text: Clippers cut through anything, however, it's very loud, gets extremely hot, and will nick skin. My dog already has anxiety and it's extremely stressful to cut his hair with these clippers. The cable is also pretty thick and will get on the way.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what we needed for our curly haired Sheepadoodle with hair that mats close to the skin as soon as it starts to get just a little long. He hates being brushed (he's a rescue) so we must keep his coat short. The clippers are quiet, have two speeds and you can purchase different size blades to go with it. A little bulky for tight spots, will need to purchase the smaller clippers for toes, face and under arm areas. Generally a very good starting place. Easy to use for the non-groomer if you go slowly and carefully and have clipped your pet's in the past. Am really glad that we purchased these clippers. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: PTLRDH

customer_reviews.title: Positive reviews must be fake!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. The screws holding the blades on vibrated out once every use. Would not trim my dogs hair under any circumstance unless we trimmed him with scissors first. My dog has allergies and gets a bath weekly and his hair is always short. We tried to use different blades to no avail. It would overheat during every use. We basically had to stop when it started burning my hand. Dog grooming turned into a full day affair. It is basically a head trimmer for people. After 2 years of fighting with it, it found itself in the trash this week. The only reason it made it so long was that it cost too much to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: CueBee 42

customer_reviews.title: Oster quality has gone downhill in recent years
customer_reviews.text: After using Oster clippers for 30+ years, I am sorry to say I am done with this brand. These did not cut right straight out of the box. There is something messed up with the mechanism that allows the blade to snap on and off. It doesn't allow the blade to sit quite right, making the clippers super loud and the blade vibrates like its loose and it won't cut. I bought the 1 speed Oster clipper about 6 months ago and had the exact same problem! They are really charging a lot of money for junk clippers. VERY disappointed. Looks like I'll be switching to Andis brand.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schellhorn

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great buy for me
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great buy for me. My little rescue pup loves getting all that long hair shaved off. I don't have to spend $60+ a month in grooming fees as I just leash him outside and shave away. Wonderful. Yes, the first time I used it, I missed spots and he did look a little weird but he didn't care. Each time after that, I got better and better and all my neighbors are so jealous they're wasting money on grooming! Yea Me!
customer_reviews.author: AddisonRie

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Wahl and stays way cooler
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on purchasing such an expensive clipper. After all, I’ve been using the standard Wahl brand for the first year on my 90lbs Goldendoodle. The clippers work SOOO much better and are WAY faster. Plus the cut and finish is more even, as well. Interestingly enough, the Andis blades are also interchangeable with these clippers. I found this out when I went to PetCo. and they didn’t carry the Oster brand blade I wanted (4FC). All in all a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: This expensive item worked for about 15 minutes. Then it started to pull hair.
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy. This clipper worked for only about 15 minutes then it started to pull hair. I have had several of these machines, but this was the worst. I suspect that there is something wrong in the factory. Will return and try again in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: mpbsempre

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you have a long haird cat!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to shave my long haired cat who hates to be shaved. These were amazing. They get hot but cool fast. No pulling on the fur. It was extremely easy to cut my longhair cat into a beautiful lion.
customer_reviews.author: Wilder@heart

customer_reviews.title: Tightened the screw and it worked better than before
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for trimming my 3 Burmese Mountain dogs. Struggled a little to get through their thick winter coats a little. Noticed some rattling when I switched out blades at one point. Removed the blade and noticed a loose screw. Tightened the screw and it worked better than before. Does get hot to hold near the blade after about 15 minutes of use, but adjusting my grip worked fine. Cools quickly when shut off. Would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Pollywannacracker

customer_reviews.title: Worked on a standard poodle
customer_reviews.text: I've burned out three pairs of clippers due to our standard poodles hair. These worked great without heating up and cuts so quick and easy. I cannot recommend them more to those with similar hair. The noise was very low and vibration minimal as well. We like to keep a shorter cut during the summer months, so the guard was good. I will need to add a few other guards for our cooler months.
customer_reviews.author: Webb

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning. Too late to return
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in March and didnt use until about a week ago. Cant switch the blade as blade will not go completely on. The blade that came with them is the only one that works.Got extremely hot within 2 minutes of use. Wish i had used them sooner so i could have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great clipper for full body haircuts (on dogs or course)
customer_reviews.text: I read on another review that the replacement blades were actually sharper than the blade that comes with the clipper. That may be true because once I put on the new blade, I cut my dog easier than I ever have before. It was a breeze. They were really good clippers for my shitzu and for a poodle I just did. I'm doing a cocker spaniel next week. I'm a new groomer so I read lots of reviews before I spent the money. I am very satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This clipper is high quality - having two speeds is nice especially for my pup who gets anxious during grooming ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional, but have had several different generic clippers for my dogs over the years. I bought these along with investing in some accompanying quality pieces to avoid the $120 grooming fees for my two welsh terriers. This clipper is high quality - having two speeds is nice especially for my pup who gets anxious during grooming to reduce noise. I would highly recommend this product but be sure to purchase quality blades to accompany this product. I have two welsh terriers with wire-haired coats and this set of clippers has not trouble cutting through their hair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful clippers, amazingly sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a wonderful grooming tool for my pup but I needed to return. I have much numbness in my hands since spinal surgeries and, though the blade was adequate to cut my curly guy, the weight was going to be a problem fir me as an amateur groomer with little feeling in my hand, I felt uneasy cutting with little control. Size was nice, it was just to heavy fir me to trust not cutting the dog. High quality, blade very sharp, wish I had been able to hold fir as long as it takes.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A Pistello

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: Had an Oster A5 for 5 years before it went missing. Have a long haired dog that it takes forever to trim. This clipper is as good as the one from years ago. Cuts right thru the dogs hair like nothing. People complain they overheat, but compared to other clippers this one just gets slightly warm. Blades do get warm, but even proffesional groomers use a cooling spray for the blades. Trick is use the lower speed once the heavy clipping is done. The cipper itself gets warm at the exhaust openings. Just keep your hand lower on the clipper instead of by the vents.
customer_reviews.author: Arlen Pietrowski

customer_reviews.title: LOUD, GETS HOT
customer_reviews.text: Within a few minutes of using the clipper, blade gets really hot and bothers my dogs to where they won't sit still for grooming . I have to stop and wait for it to cool down, which makes the grooming take a lot longer. Last time I order Oster products. I've purchased Oster grooming products for years, but this last time the clipper is not the same quality that I've purchased in the past. There's got to be a better product out there where the blades don't get so hot.
customer_reviews.author: JA Rost

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I cannot really tell if it is the blade or if it is the "Professional OSTER ULTRA clippers that" that are inferior. I have had trouble with most brands of grooming clippers. Oster is definitely my worst experience, AND how often do we groom a dog? Once every 4-6 weeks and by the second cut, trying to give product a chance to see if they are good or as poor as you suspect they are, it is too late to return. They overheat quickly, they are heavy and my schnauzer is terrified of them. Now I can return neither the clippers or the blades. There should be a larger window on products that typically are not used often.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just started grooming my 3 dogs. This works really well. It is easy to change the blades and does a good job cutting thru my poodle’s hair. I’m still a work in process learning the best way to groom (but YT videos are helping). But after trying a couple other clippers, this is my favorite to use. It is just much faster when you have the right clipper.
customer_reviews.author: A regular shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cotton candy Persian hair approved!
customer_reviews.text: We have a “cotton candy” haired Persian who has been banned from the salon. Jasmine was notorious for her stellar personality with the staff and her large matting problem every spring. We brushed her everyday and still had a massive matting problem. After convincing my family to risk the expensive purchase—- it paid off (thank god!). We will still need practice getting the cut even but HOLY MOLE this cuts through matting like butter for fine hair pets. Yes, it gets hot fast so we have to take breaks every few minutes but it still does it’s job. Amazing!! so glad I got this!
customer_reviews.author: lala_Ichabod

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This product is unacceptable. I will return if I kept the box it came in. It became too hot to hold within 5 minutes. I tried both low and high speeds. The dogs objected to it being used around their feet and it seemed to pull their hair rather than cut it. I have been trimming dogs for more than 30 years (springers, setters) and never had this problem with Andis or some older Wahl clippers. I used 5, 7F and 10 blades and finally managed to rough trim one of my dogs. I could not use it to do a good job. I would give it no stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: katharine bauer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: This product came in the original box, which was opened on one end and damaged. The product looks like it was used and the integrity of it is not lined up. I also thought there would be multiple attachments, but after reading fine print, I was informed just not very effectively. So, only one blade! I hope it works otherwise I will be sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: lkinyon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are fantastic! I wish I had ordered them long ago! They work so quickly and effectively the dogs are almost done before they realize I'm trimming or shaving them! These are much faster than my previous Oster clippers, I'm very, very happy with them. My cavalier king charles has fur that gets quite thick and would jam up my previous clippers, this clipper sails through his fur.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D in TN

customer_reviews.title: Loud, but WORKS WONDERS!
customer_reviews.text: So it is pretty darn noisy, but this thing is a beast. I have an ancient maltipoo and she gets snarls and mats all the time. I find at her age it’s easier to keep her clipped pretty short, as it cuts down bath time and brushing. These clippers got the job done lightning fast! It usually takes me hours to fully clip her. I got her done in 30 minutes. Love this thing. It does get pretty toasty, so make sure you keep an eye on that.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, smooth action
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice clipper set. I use it to shave down my dog several times a year. The blades are sharp and it works well. It is packaged nicely and I use the box as storage for it. The blade action is smooth. It has a very long cord which makes it convenient to get around my pet as I'm using it. It is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot but works very well
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a high and low switch at the base of the clipper... I used a low setting, trimmed my Cocker Spaniel completely down (matted hair and all) in about 45 minutes. These clippers come with a 10 blade which says medium shave but I think it was even shorter than that...either way my pup was a happy one!! He looks so handsome and much younger than 23 years old!! The unit gets very hot at the base but it was very easy to use and it didn't knick, hurt or frighten my doggy. If you can stand the heat at the base I would definitely recommend!! (And I saved $125 grooming fee!! gotta love that!)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. A. Longoria, PhD

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Doo Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended these by my friend and Groomer Ritzi Rover on El Paseo in Palm Desert; I used them on my Scottie Katie and loved them; it has 2 variable speeds and I only used low speed due to my Scottie not liking the high speed sound of the clippers. There well made, somewhat heavy with a thick and long insulated cord so there's really no need for an extension cord. It comes with the #10 blade which is the recommended blade for doing a Scottie Cut. I would highly recommend these over any OTC grooming clipper for its well worth the money...........:)
customer_reviews.author: RainbowRV

customer_reviews.title: Get super hot, super fast,  within minutes of using
customer_reviews.text: I debated on a one star or a 2 star. I groom our 2 standard poodles. I have always used Oster clippers for our dogs. I can't believe these new clippers are pretty terrible. They rattle. But the worst thing is how hot they get and how fast they get hot. It was within minutes. I have tried them twice for those few minutes before they got too hot to handle or put on my dog. I would like to return them and get a refund. I really need a good clipper. So I will be replacing them, but I'm upset to have wasted this money.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the Turbo A5 Oster Clipper
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this product. It is louder and heavier than other similar clippers. The blade also became hot to the touch. My dog did not like having it near her. After about a year and a half, the unit became progressively louder despite regular cleaning and oiling, then stopped working all together. Found the FURminator Comfort Pro Electric Clipper, to be a much better alternative for my 62 pound dog.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: This shaver worked liked a charm
customer_reviews.text: Got this to trim my dog. She has a very thick coat! This shaver worked liked a charm, but I will say that a few others have said, it does get warm! Also could depend on the place you trim your dog. (outside/inside) The only down side is that today is prime day and I could of saved myself a little over $20 dollars. Company's know when they are going to have sales just wish they would reimburse you the difference if you bought it within a couple of weeks. Overall good product
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Florez

customer_reviews.title: Descent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Very loud and heat up after a bit, gave to taje breaks and let the blade cool. Cuts very well though and has a nice long cord.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: Works like a hot knife through butter!
customer_reviews.text: This, by any means, is not quiet. It's very loud, specially on the second setting. But, they work like magic! Cuts hair with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: These shears are super and with two speeds helps in handling thicker mat ...
customer_reviews.text: These shears are super and with two speeds helps in handling thicker mat pets for easier cutting of matted hair. Would highly recommend these to people which do a lot of there own cutting or even professional groomers. There are extra blades that can be purchased making this product even more beneficial. Exactly as shown in picture.
customer_reviews.author: James Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Good but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Loved them at first but then after about 5 cuts the blade kept rattling bc the little black tab that when down held the blade tight kept sliding up due to the powerful motor. When it got lose and rattled it wouldnt cut effectively
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: I was excited...and then I wasn't.
customer_reviews.text: Two uses in and it started to not cut as clean and sharp as I expected. Leaves LINES in my dogs coat when cutting short. I had really high hopes for it. It's still better than my old cheapo budget clippers from Walmart... but left me seriously underwhelmed. It gets hot pretty fast, too. Can't say it's worth the price tag. I just cant. It's built like a tank, but just doesn't impress me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Bad Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Ordered product for dog grooming. Have used this brand and style for years. Love it, lasts a long time, like the 2 speeds. I ordered it through Amazon services, and it was not shipped in a box, it was labeled all over the clipper box AND the box was so banged up and ripped. Clippers work fortunately. Recommend that you click "gift" box so they don't just slap a sticker on it and mail as it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed experience
customer_reviews.text: I have used an Oster clipper for my horse and dogs in the past and was excited to get a new one for my dog. Regretfully, the blades just do not sit close enough to the clipper to work efficiently, and when I put an attachment to the blade, the cut is uneven and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am asking for help. We purchased this cutter ...
customer_reviews.text: I am asking for help. We purchased this cutter as we own the older model from years past. Want to upgrade. The new clippers ar not working well. They made a loud noise and get very hot when using. We have used the new clippers about a dozen times. I had to tighten the two phillips screws were the blade attach. I have tighten them again but the unit is still loud and hot. I s the something that can be done to correct the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Raney

customer_reviews.title: Did not cut poodle hair
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't even get through one 10 pound toy poodle without the machine becoming so hot it was unpleasant for the dog, and without the clippers becoming gummed up and refusing to cut. I have shorn sheep, trimmed many breeds of dog, and I know about proper lubrication and blade care. I was disappointed in how easily these clippers were bested by even clean dog fur. It's also not possible to do any self-maintenance of the blades; top and bottom are basically one unit. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut at all!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Oyster clippers before and been pleased with the brand. I purchased to turbo A 5 last summer. I didn't try it for several months, (misteak) and when I did I was shocked to learn that it not only got hot but it doesn't cut at all unless I hold up a few hairs at a time. I read and reread instructions, checked to be positive I had the blades on right, I have oiled and cleaned it many times. It has never cut more than a few hair at a time. I have a large sheep dog. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nalley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and definitely heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Louder than our old one (a generic brand), but it gets the job done much faster and with less struggle. Its heavier as well, but not too heavy. Sturdy, and definitely heavy duty. Only one negative for this product - the instructions were useless. Had a bit of a struggle figuring out how to change the attachments, which is silly, because its easy once you know how - but a picture would have been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: E Madsen

customer_reviews.title: I plan to contact seller because something is wrong with these clippers.  They do not cut hair smoothly and the motor rattles
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these clippers April and used them 2 times. It was like chewing the hair off, horrible clippers. I have same brand and model for 11 years and thought I would get a new one. But the motor is making a rattling noise. I will contact the seller after the holiday. I am very sad because my old clippers were great for many hair cuts on my schnauzer and something is wrong with this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sandilee4u

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, high quality, pays for itself quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product allows me to groom my cat from the comfort of my home without paying an arm and a leg. Yes, it’s pricey but pays off in 1-2 visits you would have had at the groomer. It does get hot after 15min but I hear using clipper cooling spray will help this. This is super high quality - I’ve tried cheaper brands and it was near impossible to groom my Himalayan cat. Now it’s easy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: The cutting blade gets warm to hot. It cuts great. My cat is now shaved. Size guards do not do well with long, thick haired cats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what's its designed to do!
customer_reviews.text: First, Im not a professional groomer. My wife doesn't trust her poodle with a groomer so the job falls on me. This is a great clipper. Cut through matted poodle hair pretty easily, I was surprised. Seems like I wait to long and before you know it the hair gets matted. This worked really well, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rodion Meglin

customer_reviews.title: Good clipper
customer_reviews.text: Bought this clipper to cut my dog hair., he is a bichon . Iike the clipper, cut fast they seem and feel heavy duty. Nevertheless the noise seem a little too much for for my dog. I do as much as I can and have to finish him with scissors. Hopefully he will get used to the noise, otherwise this are great clipper.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We have had several less expensive clippers throughout the years to groom our dogs and have always been unhappy with their performance so we took the plunge and bough these heavy duty clippers. Very pleased with the way they groom without problems. Enough power to do a professional grooming job and the dogs, and cats don't seem to be bothered by it.
customer_reviews.author: Coventryhale

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. It was highly recommended for heavy coats. I have angora rabbits, and it doesn't work at all on them. it's supposed to be a professional product, but it doesn't work for me at all. I ended up giving mine away, as it was absolutely useless. And, yes, I purchased all the necessarry extra blades. I finally have ended up using a really expensive set of kitchen scissors, and cutting by hand. Total waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade
customer_reviews.text: This clippers are amazing!! They are pricey but well worth the cost. My dog has a super thick coat and these shear through like a hot nice through butter. With the cost of a groomer increasing every trip, if you have a little patience these clipper will pay for themselves in no time.
customer_reviews.author: J Young

customer_reviews.title: oh well...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our shitzhu puppy. These puppies grow hair like weeds. While using the clipper, we noticed it got really hot very quickly. We would turn it off, wait about 5 mins for it to cool down. Yes we oiled the blades, cleaned the oscillating arm, and not hold the breathing holes. So though it is useable for 5 mins, after that this time, it gets too hot to use. I spend about 10 mins shaving my dog at a time. One year later, I think it was a dud of a motor because a groomer says she can cut hair for hours with the clippers getting just warm, not hot.
customer_reviews.author: luke

customer_reviews.title: Powerful clippers, I’m pleased
customer_reviews.text: Im pretty pleased with this product. It helped me save grooming money for my large, first generation golden doodle. His fur has a wiry golden retriever feel but it’s curly like a poodle. Fur was long and somewhat matted. These Oster clippers cut through it all easily. I was impressed with the power and relieved that my money wasn’t wasted! The blade does get hot so that needs to be monitored and this set does not include guards but they can be purchased individually online. Clippers are pretty loud but the lower speed is not as loud as speed 2. The cord is plenty long for us.
customer_reviews.author: HCS

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver for dogs and cats
customer_reviews.text: A great shaver for dogs with thick fur, but the plate gets hot quickly and requires breaks to cool down. I have a dog with thick fur like a bear and this shaver plows thru it in one pass leaving a nice, smooth short coat with few shaver marks. Although technique and practice are required to do a decent job with even length and no marks. This shaver would be good on long haired cats also although it's loud.
customer_reviews.author: WuZetian

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: After researching clippers and reading comments on these I decided to purchase this brand at the beginning of June 2020. Clippers worked great the 2 times I used them. Got them out to use for the 3rd time and they wouldn’t even cut any kind of hair without force. I cleaned them, oiled them. Couldn’t imagine they would need sharpened being I only used them twice. When they did work, they worked great but now it’s past the return time and I’m stuck with clippers that won’t clip.
customer_reviews.author: carissa718

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last one use!
customer_reviews.text: Old pair of A-5 clippers still running great but needed a second pair to make clipping our herd of dairy goats go faster at show time. I was halfway through clipping one miniature goat when the clippers started squealing. My husband took them apart and found a plastic gear stripped. I'm guessing these were returned by someone else and sent out to me. They rattled funny from the start but I tightened the screw and they were ok, so I didn't think much of it. Now just past the 30 day window- too late to return to Amazon. Wasted $108.00
customer_reviews.author: tacy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Clipper with Lovely Long Cord!
customer_reviews.text: We have a pair of Great Pyrenees and these Clippers with two speeds do an excellent job! The low noise is very nice as it doesn’t upset either of the boys in the least while they are being Groomed. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John Adivari

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: I tried all sorts of clippers on my german shepherd / lab before i got these. Petco had these for around $180. The best clippers i tried before these were some wahl seniors, but even those werent enough to cut through my dogs fur. All other clippers got caught and wouldnt cut an inch of fur. I put these to her fur, and they cut like no ones bussines, cut so smooth. Doesnt heat up too bad bit when it does, just spray some coolimg spray, andis or oster cool care doesnt matter. Best of the best.
customer_reviews.author: efren

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers
customer_reviews.text: These things are work horses! I groomed 2 very large poodles effortlessly for 3 years before needing to replace a piece of them. Very strong. The only think to watch for, is they are loud and get pretty hot. Not a huge issue for me, but it could be a problem if your dog is skittish or you don’t want to deal with cooling off the blades or buying extras to swap them out
customer_reviews.author: Amber Guentmer

customer_reviews.title: No Cats Allowed........
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good clipper for use on a cat! While it will definitely cut the fur off a Ragdoll cat, it was way to noisy for our cat and he's use to getting haircuts. The one we got was also defective, it got hot with 10 minutes of use, 20 minutes before the blade was to hot for the pet, and the speed seemed like it had to have time to build up to full speed when on the second speed selection. It is also a little on the bulky and heavy side. We sent ours back and will keep looking for something else a lot more quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blades rattled constantly. Can't return.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and the return window is expired on this set. On both sets the blades rattled. I kept having to tighten the screws on the blades. They'd work for 2 seconds then stop cutting. Really annoying when you're in the middle of cutting dogs. I'm not a professional groomer but have been cutting my dogs for years. Now, I have to find a warranty center to see if they can fix this set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed as we have a ragdoll that needs clipping and ...
customer_reviews.text: Only used this product a couple of times before it stopped working. Very disappointed as we have a ragdoll that needs clipping and we now need to pay a groomer to cut her fur which is rather traumatic for her. Clipper worked great at first but now only pulls her hair and does not cut. Had the clipper looked at but still not cutting!!! Apparently only offered a 30 warranty by the seller so we are out of luck!
customer_reviews.author: lisa hartwig

customer_reviews.title: Broke during second use
customer_reviews.text: This clipper broke during its second use. Is not within 30 day return period, so was out of luck. I have purchased this brand for ten years and have recently had nothing but problems with it. They cost too much money to only work for a handful of shaves. I recently started to purchase a $22 clipper from Amazon and I have never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: UKCAT

customer_reviews.title: Stress-free grooming clipper in this Oster A5, for me and my Mini Schnauzer....so worth the price! Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.text: I groom my own Mini Schnauzers and this clipper works great, like slicing through butter! I have tried cheaper models and always end up throwing them out in frustration! This is my second Oster A5 and very happy with the quality and ease of this clipper. I have paid for the cost within the first (2) grooming sessions at home, plus no stress on my Fritz with a long day away at the groomers. Highly recommend investing in this product, very quick delivery, used the first day it arrived and he now looks handsome once again!
customer_reviews.author: Stavis Bay USA

customer_reviews.title: Ok when they actually work
customer_reviews.text: They're ok when they work. The clipper blade that snaps in doesn't always line up correctly. When it does line up, it's for a brief period. I've purchased two and won't purchase a 3rd.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Very good pet clipper
customer_reviews.text: Easy on/off switch at bottom where cord is, works great, not too scary for the dog. I didn't need all those attachments for different hair lengths because I was doing one area on my pet. I bought the oil lubricant as another product but it comes with a bottle so you don't need to buy extra. Cleaning is just dusting off the blades. No maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: This wiil get er done!
customer_reviews.text: My first quality animal clippers. NOT going to the groomers @ $90.00 every 3months will be a huge savings. Be sure to get a good blade...I got a 7F blade here on Amazon. The clippers come with a #10 blade. I learned that the larger the number the closer the blade cuts so be careful. A number 7 gives a nice smooth cut without prickley hair stubs that irritate the dogs skin. I also bought "The Everthing Dog Grooming" book here on Amazon( a must have if you are new to grooming). The A5 feels like quality, and has a quality appearance. The motor is powerful with 2 settings. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JEV Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Still a quality Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I actually have an A5 from the mid 70's. It's getting a little tired so I thought I would update. I'm not certain this new turbo model is quite up the quality of the older ones but it appears to be pretty well made and it's nice having two speeds. To do a good job on a dog with a thick, tough coat you really need both a good electric trimmer as well as a variety of good blades. Fortunately this company has both.
customer_reviews.author: MarkjinNY

customer_reviews.title: Great for 'sheep fur' dog hair!
customer_reviews.text: I have an extremely furry dog, her hair is like sheep's wool. I have been through many other clippers and am back to these. They are by far the fastest and easiest way to get through her hair in the shortest amount of time- with no razor burn! They do get hot pretty quickly but they all do. I just cut for about 15-20 minutes then take a break. Another 15-20 minute trimming session an hour later and I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy J. McCane

customer_reviews.title: So high a price for so little performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to groom my 6 year old poodle mix. She is typically very calm while being groomed. These clippers were loud, they heated up very quickly and it was a struggle to keep her still because the noise was upsetting her and these did not cut the hair at all. These pulled and seemed to bog down in her hair. I tried different techniques and different angles. I am returning them in hopes of finding some more suitable.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Easter

customer_reviews.title: Good but average.
customer_reviews.text: Was really hopeful about these clippers. Have gone through three other pairs of clippers for our doodle. He is really thick so we bought these hoping they'd do the trick. But we haven't even made it through his first hair cut and the blade isn't able to get through his thick and curly hair. Just gets caught and pulls on his fur. The clipper is really good just isn't doing the trick. Really nice that you can detach the blade for when it does eventually get dull if you decide to go with these. We are returning it though because it still isn't able to get through his thick fur.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot
customer_reviews.text: I did all the things recommended in the instructions about oiling the blades and cleaning. The blade still got hot after only 5 mins of use. You need blade coolant to use this clipper. It's a heavy clipper, as well, but it does clip the fur of my Standard Poodle very nicely. Feels substantial. Good for bigger dogs. It operates well and does the job, I just wish is stayed cooler longer.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Long-Haired Cats
customer_reviews.text: I have been through multiple clippers from Walmart trying to find one that works for long and extremely soft cat fur. I had no trouble cutting through my long-haired cats silky fur with this one! What is usually an hour long and stressful ordeal, took only 20 minutes with this clippers. I had no issues with cutting his skin, like I've experienced with other models. This clippers runs quietly, and remains cool to the touch. Having clipped a number of species' fur, from dogs and cats, to goats over the years, I can say this is a wonderful product. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chrislyn

customer_reviews.title: Like and will purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in September 2013 and this machine saved me hundreds of dollars in grooming costs. After almost 5 years of use, the clippers stopped cutting despite buying a replacement blade a few months ago. With that said, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: crystall7

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a trimmer that can do what it is supposed to do. Some of my long hair cats have knots in their fur. As they get older they tend not to groom themselves as much as they should. I used to spend hours slowly cutting them off with a scissors. I tried other shavers before but they did not do a very good job at all. Now this product cuts the fur off very easily. I can give them a lions cut and they are very happy. And the blade does not get too hot which is good. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful but it overheats very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because my puppy "screamed" from the clipper over-heating. I am simply giving 2 stars because it is really powerful.. But Oster should redesign their equipment so it doesn't get overheated to burn someone up.
customer_reviews.author: WonderingDuck0408

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Heavy with Dull Blade!
customer_reviews.text: This Oster Professional trimmer is way too heavy to hold and try to trim hair and it snags rather than cutting my dog's hair...he doesn't like the loud sound either. I tried it on my hair which is a lot thinner than my dogs and it snags on my hair. I cannot recommend this product. The price is over $100 which is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Craftylady

customer_reviews.title: WASTE
customer_reviews.text: screws in the head come lose and needed to be tightened multiple times during haircut. Eventually the clippers just stopped working. When the clippers were working they did not do a very good job. I have a beard trimmer that does a better job on my dog. Don't waste your money on this piece. Took me hours to finish my dog. Got about 6 cuts out of this thing before it died on me.
customer_reviews.author: robert morris

customer_reviews.title: Get hot quick
customer_reviews.text: Good set of clippers. Only downside is they get HOT quick. I am sure to constantly use lube to keep the blades cool (about ever 2 mins or less) but they seem to get super hot. My older oster clippers broke when I dropped them and I got these as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Chele

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Second pair in 30 years. Loved my first pair which I paid almost double for but well worth the price. This clipper is a work horse. I have an animal rescue n whether just grooming or working on an injury these clippers can do the job. I have blades from 4 - 40 which gives me the perfect clip every time. These clippers have an extra long cord, well insulated, a release to change out the blades easily, n are better ventilated to slow down the heating on the blade n handle. I use blade coolant to reduce the heat on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Bkind

customer_reviews.title: Ran VERY hot, Oster warranty replacement was a less expensive model
customer_reviews.text: Even on the low speed this clipper ran VERY hot, definitely something wrong. We waited too long to have Amazon replace it, sent it to Oster service for service or replacement under warranty. Oster sent a brand new single speed A5 to replace it, a less expensive model, not very good service IMO. But we figured the single speed is likely to be more reliable so we didn't press the matter, didn't really want a two speed replacement. So I'd give a one star for reliability and one and a half stars for Oster's warranty service. FWIW we have been using Oster clippers in our animal hospital for over 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: not so good
customer_reviews.text: This is worthless, JUNK.... will not cut my cats long hair, I can not even get it to penetrate his fuzzy fur, useless to me... Another reason to buy in person and forget about Amazon, wasted money....
customer_reviews.author: James T. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty loud
customer_reviews.text: The sound is not a quiet hum like some other clippers. It is loud and sounds mechanical. Hopefully, I'll find some pluses with this clipper so it can get it's score up.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Ran good and body of trimmer didn’t vibrate excessively or get ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it on 2 dogs. Ran good and body of trimmer didn’t vibrate excessively or get overly hot. Seems very well made. You will inadvertently hit off switch when hand is low. That’s mostly operater error, however switch lever could be held in position stronger. Worth paying a little more for this Oster over the others I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfden

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced junk
customer_reviews.text: I agree with MBUG, mine has been horrible, the blade will not stay on and it vibrates like crazy. Also gets very hot. I took it to my groomer once to reset it and it happened again the next time I used it. I have had a labradoodle for 4 years and can’t afford to take her all the time and now I have her daughter who has a different coat and I have to get something reliable. The pathetic manual that came with it was of no help trying to get the blade to stay on, wish I could return it but have waited to long. I am going to try the Wahl brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Poates

customer_reviews.title: dependability,  quality
customer_reviews.text: Oster is a great product. Durable dependable. We use this one to trim our old english sheepdog. We don't even need to use max speed and the oster smoothly cuts thru his hair. No disappointments
customer_reviews.author: arnie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This thing owns. I have a big labradoodle with coarse, thick hair and I've tried other clippers in the past. This one blows all the others away. Pony up for the real deal and don't get the cheap clipper, buy quality and save money in the long run. Strongly recommend. Paid for this with real money, no promos.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas J Watson

customer_reviews.title: Husky owner's need the size 8-1/2 blade!!!
customer_reviews.text: It ships with a "training" type of blade(size #10) that's a pain to cut with, but it's kind of nice, as a safety measure. It ensures you don't hurt your baby by going too low. I recommend getting the guard-set again for safety, if you're not a pro, I did. Also, order and received the size 8-1/2 blade, then tried it on my boy and it goes through his husky undercoat easily.
customer_reviews.author: nk

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste monry to scare your pets!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this Oster, and I spent a fortune on it!! It's heavy and hard to hold. It's so loud my animals are terrified! I will never trust Oster again!!
customer_reviews.author: packers fan in oklahoma

product_meta.title: Oster A5 Two Speed Animal Grooming Clipper with Detachable Cryogen-X #10 Blade
product_meta.description: Style:Grooming Clipper - Wired| Size:6.00 x 10.50 x 3.00 inches| Color:BlueThe Oster Professional Turbo A5 Heavy Duty Animal Grooming Clippers offer a fast and easy way to groom pets and livestock. With a heavy-duty 2-speed universal motor that delivers up to 4,000 strokes per minute (SPM) and a wider blade sweep, these pet clippers glide through thick, coarse hair easily--including heavily matted hair. The universal motor is designed to be quiet, providing a more pleasant grooming experience. These electric clippers offer two speeds for ideal versatility. The low speed provides precision with quieter performance perfect for clipping sensitive areas, while the high speed delivers maximum power for faster trims and full body shave downs. Ideal for dogs, cats, horses, and livestock, the Professional Turbo A5 pet clippers come with a detachable #10 CryogenX blade, blade oil, clipper grease, a cleaning brush, and replacement carbon brushes. Dimensions: 1.9 inch H x 2.1 inch W x 8.2 icnh L, Weight:1.7 Pounds,Cord length: 12 feet,Watts: 45 W, Compatible with all Oster A5 detachable blades.Turbo Powered for Higher strokes per minute and 2 Speeds 3000 SPM Low 4000 SPM High
feature_bullets: Animal clippers deliver more strokes per minute and a wider blade sweep for faster clipping
Powerful, heavy-duty universal motor delivers 2 speeds: 3,000 SPM and 4,000 SPM
Clipper is ideal for grooming dogs, cats, horses, and livestock. Compatible with Oster A5 detachable Cryogen-X blades, and Elite Cryogen-X and Take Down Quick Wide blade series
Detachable A5 blade system makes blade changes quick and easy
Includes detachable #10 CryogenX blade, blade oil, clipper grease, cleaning brush, and replacement carbon brushes

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
